DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Enable or disable KDUMP operation. These commands require a reboot to complete.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use the command "kdump enable" to enable the kdump operation. Use the command "no kdump" to disable the kdump operation.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# enable kdump KDUMP configuration has been updated in the startup configuration Kdump configuration changes will be applied after the system reboots sonic(config)# no kdump KDUMP configuration has been updated in the startup configuration ALERT! A system reboot is highly recommended. Kdump configuration changes will be applied after the system reboots

PARAM.name: kdump_memory
PARAM.help: The amount of memory reserved for kdump

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Set or reset to default the amount of memory reserved for kdump. These commands require a reboot to complete.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use the commands "kdump memory <X>" or "no kdump memory" to set or reset to default the amount of memory reserved for kdump.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# kdump memory 512M KDUMP configuration has been updated in the startup configuration kdump updated memory will be only operational after the system reboots sonic(config)# no kdump memory
